cover.title: YOU WANT ME
cover.content: If you arrived here, it means you are really interested into my skills, and I cannot be more happy! After reading this page, you should want nothing but hire me. So let's get started on why I should join AIRTAME.

cards.title: University Degree in CS & Co.
cards.description: I am finishing my Bachelor of Software Engineering at McGill University. I am missing 5 classes which I will do next semester.

cards.title: C
cards.description: I have developped a simple file system in C (SimpleFS). It is far from being exploitable, but the doc should help you understand how it works.

cards.title: C++
cards.description: I have not had a lot of experience with C++, but I am not afraid to learn. After playing a bit with MIPS, I must admit new languages don't scare me no more.

cards.title: OSS
cards.description: It kindof goes along with switching to linux. I have never bought a single software in my life: The Open Source Mentality might be one of my strongest trait as of today (after being awesome obviously).

cards.title: TCP/IP Networking
cards.description: Last semester, a close friend and I started to study in depth the AirPlay Protocol. You can also check out the presentation.

cards.title: OOP
cards.description: Even if it is not my favourite language, I must admit Java is one of my strong suit. My team and I got the highest goals with our StormChaser back in 2012.

cards.title: Networking Experience
cards.description: Assuming you are talking about Computer Networking ;). I have extensively used tools such as Bactrack, its successor, Kali, and used my home server for a year as an exit node on the Tor Network.

cards.title: Cross-Platform
cards.description: I tried my first linux distro (Mandriva) in 2004, and quickly gave up on Windows back in 2008. I switched distros multiple times, going from Mint, Ubuntu, elementaryOS, Puppy, to end up on Fedora, on which I have been for the past 4 years.

cards.title: Version Control and Doc
cards.description: I only swear by git. I have tried others such as SVN and Mercurial, but the hype around GitHub made me throw everything on git. No regrets fosho. For what concerns documentation, I cultivate a strong hatred for github repos without README...
